intro: Centaurea achaia var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate Greek knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces bright yellow to orange flowers arranged in dense, composite flower heads, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in grasslands and rocky areas. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
